id.description: Unique identifier from the GADM dataset

month.description: Emissions month. Can be omitted if endpoints support `timeGranularity` parameter and is set to "year".

rank.description: Global rank by subsector for total CO2 emissions produced by the parent source/asset in the specified year.

id.description: Unique identifier from the GHS FUA dataset

emissionsPerCapita.description: per capita emissions based on annual population data

rank.description: rank within the filtered list of countries

cityId.description: unique identifier of an Urban Area in the GHS FUA dataset

gadmId.description: unique identifier of an Administrative Area in the GADM dataset

models.SourceCentroid.description: Location of the emission source. For "point-source" facilities, these are the actual coordinates of the emissions source, whereas for spatially aggregated emissions sources, the coordinates correspond roughly to the centroid of the boundary being aggregated. See also `sourceType`.

srid.description: Spatial reference identifier denoting a coordinate reference system

assetType.description: Description of the emission source classification.

country.description: Corresponds to the ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 specification of the country where the entity is physically located.

emissions.description: Time series of emissions over the target time range. `timeGranularity` parameter determines units of time.

id.description:
The internal Climate TRACE identifier for each individual source of emissions. Every distinct emissions source
is defined by a unique combination of facility name, country, source type, and subsector.

name.description:
Name of the entity or source that produced the emissions. Where exact names were not available, Climate TRACE
has created descriptive names based on source location.

sector.description: The high level sector that the subsectors fall under (i.e. Agriculture, Mineral Extraction, etc.)

sourceType.description: Indicates whether the emission source has a specific location or is spatially aggregated over an administrative boundary or functional urban area.

subsector.description: The more granular sector name for the emissions being measured (i.e. rice-cultivation, copper-mining, etc.)

models.SourceEmissionsTimePeriod.description: Cumulative emissions values over a period of time

activity.description: Activity of the entity producing the emissions, not including units. See definition of `capacity`. Activity data are not available for some subsectors due to licensing restrictions

activityUnits.description: Units of reported `activity`. Climate TRACE used SI base units and standard abbreviations when possible. https://www.nist.gov/pml/owm/metric-si/si-units

capacity.description: Capacity of the entity producing emissions, not including units. Because `capacity` has different definitions in different sectors. Please see the capacity units column for detailed information.

capacityFactor.description: Corresponds to the ratio of the actual source output (activity) to the source capacity. When data not available, this is not relevant for the subsector.

capacityUnits.description: Units of reported `capacity` field. Climate TRACE uses SI base units and standard abbreviations when possible. https://www.nist.gov/pml/owm/metric-si/si-units

emissionsFactor.description: Emissions factor of reported activity. Emissions factors vary by sector, subsector, and source type. Emission factors data are not available for some subsectors due to licensing restrictions.

emissionsFactorUnits.description: Units of reported `emissions_factor` field. Climate TRACE uses SI base units and standard abbreviations when possible. https://www.nist.gov/pml/owm/metric-si/si-units

emissionsQuantity.description: Quantity of gas emitted in metric tonnes. If reported quantity is zero, it means that gas is not emitted. If reported quantity is empty/null/NA, data is not yet available.

gas.description:
Air emissions which are reported in metric tonnes. Climate TRACE reports greenhouse gas emissions from Carbon Dioxide (CO2),
Methane (CH4) and Nitrous oxide (N2O) as well as all three gases combined and expressed in CO2-equivalents are available (100
year and 20 year time frame using IPCC Sixth Assessment Report (AR6) Global Warming Potentials). Climate TRACE reports the
air pollutants: Particulate Matter (PM2.5), Black Carbon (BC), and Organic Carbon (OC), sulphur dioxide (SO2), Volatile Organic
Compounds (VOCs), Carbon Monoxide (CO), Ammonia (NH3), and Nitrogen Oxides (NOx).

month.description: Emissions month. Can be omitted if endpoint supports `timeGranularity` parameter and is set to "year".

activity.description: Activity of the entity producing the emissions, not including units. See definition of `capacity`. Activity data are not available for some subsectors due to licensing restrictions

activityUnits.description: Units of reported `activity`. Climate TRACE used SI base units and standard abbreviations when possible. https://www.nist.gov/pml/owm/metric-si/si-units

assetType.description: Description of the emission source classification.

capacity.description: Capacity of the entity producing emissions, not including units. Because `capacity` has different definitions in different sectors. Please see the capacity units column for detailed information.

capacityFactor.description: Corresponds to the ratio of the actual source output (activity) to the source capacity. When data not available, this is not relevant for the subsector.

capacityUnits.description: Units of reported `capacity` field. Climate TRACE uses SI base units and standard abbreviations when possible. https://www.nist.gov/pml/owm/metric-si/si-units

country.description: Corresponds to the ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 specification of the country where the entity is physically located.

emissionsFactor.description: Emissions factor of reported activity. Emissions factors vary by sector, subsector, and source type. Emission factors data are not available for some subsectors due to licensing restrictions.

emissionsFactorUnits.description: Units of reported `emissions_factor` field. Climate TRACE uses SI base units and standard abbreviations when possible. https://www.nist.gov/pml/owm/metric-si/si-units

emissionsQuantity.description: Quantity of gas emitted in metric tonnes. If reported quantity is zero, it means that gas is not emitted. If reported quantity is empty/null/NA, data is not yet available.

gas.description:
Air emissions which are reported in metric tonnes. Climate TRACE reports greenhouse gas emissions from Carbon Dioxide (CO2),
Methane (CH4) and Nitrous oxide (N2O) as well as all three gases combined and expressed in CO2-equivalents are available (100
year and 20 year time frame using IPCC Sixth Assessment Report (AR6) Global Warming Potentials). Climate TRACE reports the
air pollutants: Particulate Matter (PM2.5), Black Carbon (BC), and Organic Carbon (OC), sulphur dioxide (SO2), Volatile Organic
Compounds (VOCs), Carbon Monoxide (CO), Ammonia (NH3), and Nitrogen Oxides (NOx).

id.description:
The internal Climate TRACE identifier for each individual source of emissions. Every distinct emissions source
is defined by a unique combination of facility name, country, source type, and subsector.

name.description:
Name of the entity or source that produced the emissions. Where exact names were not available, Climate TRACE
has created descriptive names based on source location.

sector.description: The high level sector that the subsectors fall under (i.e. Agriculture, Mineral Extraction, etc.)

sourceType.description: Indicates whether the emission source has a specific location or is spatially aggregated over an administrative boundary or functional urban area.

subsector.description: The more granular sector name for the emissions being measured (i.e. rice-cultivation, copper-mining, etc.)

info.description: Access emissions data produced by Climate TRACE.
info.title: Climate TRACE API

get.description: Search Administrative Areas by name, bounding box, or level

parameters.description: any part of an administrative area's name
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: spatially filter the search with a bounding box. format: minX,minY,maxX,maxY example: `bbox=-122.202,36.892,-101.208,37.484`
parameters.name: bbox

parameters.description: depth of subdivision of country administrative areas. countries = 0, states = 1, counties = 2
parameters.name: level

parameters.description: maximum number of results to return
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: index of first result. use in conjunction with limit for pagination.
parameters.name: offset

get.description: Get details about an administrative area.

parameters.description: Administrative Area id
parameters.name: id

get.description:
List the subdivisions one level below an administrative area.
Specify a country to list its states or specify a state to list its counties.

parameters.description: Administrative Area id
parameters.name: id

get.description: Search Urban Areas by name, country, or bounding box

parameters.description: any part of a city name
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: 3-letter country code
parameters.name: country

parameters.description: spatially filter the search with a bounding box. format: minX,minY,maxX,maxY example: `bbox=-122.202,36.892,-101.208,37.484`
parameters.name: bbox

parameters.description: maximum number of results to return
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: index of first result. use in conjunction with limit for pagination.
parameters.name: offset

List countries that are part of the specified continent

parameters.name: continent

get.description: List countries
Details of the specified country

parameters.name: country

get.description: List country groups
List countries that are part of the specified country group

parameters.description: country group
parameters.name: group

get.description:
List gases. GHGs (ch4, co2, co2e_100yr, co2e_20yr, n2o) are supported throughout the API.
In addition, there are non-GHG emissions data available for some sources.
List sector names
List subsectors assigned to the specified sector name

parameters.description: sector name
parameters.name: sector

get.description: List subsector names
List subsectors assigned to the specified sector name

parameters.description: subsector name
parameters.name: subsector

get.description: Search Owners by name

parameters.description: any part of an owner's name
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: maximum number of results to return
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: index of first result. use in conjunction with limit for pagination.
parameters.name: offset

get.description:
Rank countries by their emissions of a gas over a range of time.
Monthly data is available for January 2015 through the current year.
`start` and `end` support multiple formats. For best results, use
year (e.g. "2024") or month (e.g. "2024-01") formats.
If using the date format (e.g. "2024-01-01"), ensure that `start` is the first day of a month or year
and that `end` is the last day of a month or year (e.g. "2024-05-01" through "2025-05-31").

parameters.description: see Definitions for supported gases
parameters.name: gas

parameters.description: start of time range. supports multiple formats: year (2024), month (2024-01) or date (2024-01-01). year and month formats automatically use the first day of the year/month. minimum: 2015-01-01
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: end of time range. supports multiple formats: year (2024), month (2024-12) or date (2024-12-31). year and month formats automatically use the last day of the year/month. minimum: 2015-01-31
parameters.name: end

parameters.description: comma-separated list of sectors. see Definitions for supported values
parameters.name: sectors

parameters.description: comma-separated list of subsectors. see Definitions for supported values
parameters.name: subsectors

parameters.description: Country Group id. see Definitions for supported values
parameters.name: countryGroup

parameters.description: Continent name. see Definitions for supported values
parameters.name: continent

get.description:
Rank sources by their emissions quantities.
Annual data is available for 2021 through the current year.
Sources can be filtered by year, gas, location, owners, sectors, and subsectors.
The `sectors` parameter also accepts a special "all_no_forest" value, which will
return sources from all sectors except `forestry-and-land-use`.
Up to one location parameter can be used at a time: `gadmId`, `countryGroup`, `continent`, or `cityId`.

parameters.description: emissions year
parameters.name: year

parameters.description: see Definitions for supported gases
parameters.name: gas

parameters.description: comma-separated list of sectors. see Definitions for supported values
parameters.name: sectors

parameters.description: comma-separated list of subsectors. see Definitions for supported values
parameters.name: subsectors

parameters.description: Administrative Area id
parameters.name: gadmId

parameters.description: City/Urban Area id
parameters.name: cityId

parameters.description: Country Group id. see Definitions for supported values
parameters.name: countryGroup

parameters.description: Continent name. see Definitions for supported values
parameters.name: continent

parameters.description: comma-separated list of owner ids
parameters.name: ownerIds

parameters.description: maximum number of results to return
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: index of first result. use in conjunction with limit for pagination.
parameters.name: offset

get.description:
Get details and emissions data for a specific source/asset.
Monthly data is available for January 2021 through the current year.

parameters.description: source id
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: start year of time range. minimum: 2021-01-01
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: end year of time range. minimum: 2021-01-31
parameters.name: end

parameters.description: unit of time for aggregating emissions over the range defined by start/end
parameters.name: timeGranularity

parameters.description: see Definitions for supported gases
parameters.name: gas

get.description:
Get monthly aggregated emissions for a calendar year.
Emissions can be filtered by year, gas, location, owners, sectors, and subsectors.
The resulting totals are grouped by sector and subsector.
The `sectors` parameter also accepts a special "all_no_forest" value,
which returns emissions for all sectors except `forestry-and-land-use` and is
useful for obtaining totals that match those shown at https://climatetrace.org/explore which
by default excludes `forestry-and-land-use` emissions unless that sector is explicitly chosen.
Up to one location parameter can be used at a time: `gadmId`, `countryGroup`, `continent`, or `cityId`.
For `cityId` and `gadmId` levels 1 and 2 (e.g. states and counties), data is available from 2021 through the current year.
For global and `continent`, `countryGroup`, and `gadmId` level 0 (country), data is available beginning 2015 through the current year.

parameters.description: emissions year
parameters.name: year

parameters.description: see Definitions for supported gases
parameters.name: gas

parameters.description: comma-separated list of sectors. see Definitions for supported values
parameters.name: sectors

parameters.description: comma-separated list of subsectors. see Definitions for supported values
parameters.name: subsectors

parameters.description: Administrative Area id
parameters.name: gadmId

parameters.description: City/Urban Area id
parameters.name: cityId

parameters.description: Country Group id. see Definitions for supported values
parameters.name: countryGroup

parameters.description: Continent name. see Definitions for supported values
parameters.name: continent

parameters.description: comma-separated list of owner ids
parameters.name: ownerIds

tags.description: Data for aggregated emissions totals and individual sources.
tags.name: Emissions Sources

tags.description: Metadata for nations and their 1st and 2nd levels of subdivision (e.g. states and counties). Climate TRACE uses identifiers and boundary data from GADM, the Database of Global Administrative Areas. This API's endpoints use the `gadmId` parameter for a unique identifier of an administrative area.
tags.name: Administrative Areas

tags.description: Metadata for urban areas. Climate TRACE uses the GHS Functional Urban Areas (GHS-FUA) dataset for urban area identifiers, names, and boundary data. These are not the same as legal municipal boundaries.
tags.name: Cities

tags.description: Metadata for ownership of emissions sources
tags.name: Source Ownership

tags.description: Metadata for the API's common parameters and attributes.
tags.name: Definitions
